description.narrative: This Output aims at implementing quick and impactful efforts in the next four-six months, it will give the opportunity to foster strategic alliances with IFIs and bilateral donors, as well as with other UN Agencies for future actions.

sector.narrative: Build resilience to shocks and crisis

condition.narrative: Social and environmental sustainability will be enhanced through application of the UNDP Social and Environmental Standards (http://www.undp.org/ses) and related Accountability Mechanism (http://www.undp.org/secu-srm).
UNDP as the Implementing Partner will comply with the policies, procedures and practices of the United Nations Security Management System (UNSMS.)

description.narrative: Output 1. Strengthening health systems to respond to COVID-19 Output 2. Inclusive and multi-sectorial crisis management and response to COVID-19 Output 3. Socio-economic impact assessment of and recovery from COVID-19

comment.narrative:
Output 1. Strengthening health systems to respond to COVID-19
Activities:
1. Strengthen capacity of the National Disaster Management Centre to coordinate national response to the virus outbreak 2. Procure and deliver COVID-19 medical supplies for i) enhanced infection control, ii) testing, and iii) treatment in isolation centers 3. Strengthen existing Regional (DRS), district (RAS) and community health (ASC) systems to maintain access to health in rural communities 4. Improve UN clinic’s responsiveness and preparedness
Output 2. Inclusive and multi-sectorial crisis management and response to COVID-19
Activities:
1. Community engagement for prevention, response and social cohesion through the creation of influencer networks in communities and between communities with a focus on human-rights protection, gender and inclusion of the most vulnerable, while working against stigma 2. Improve points of entry for participatory management and ensure community resilience in Cacheu and Gabu through community empowerment and community surveillance mechanisms 3. Ensure business continuity of technical government counterparts and communities to support public health responses 4. Supporting the coordination mechanism for national and regional response management and early warning system 5. Supporting the national communication plan for COVID-19 building on UN agencies channels and partnerships in order to yield on socio-behavioral change 6. Fact-check application for COVID related news with long-term focus on strengthening democratic and civic culture
Output 3. Socio-economic impact assessment of and recovery from COVID-19
1. Conducting a socio-economic assessment and action plan, considering the intertwined crises, including the analysis of food security 2. Conducting a socio-economic assessment and action plan, considering the intertwined crises, including the analysis of food security 3. Establish a civil society led observatory for the illicit economy 4. Imple

Output 1. Strengthening health systems to respond to COVID-19
Activities:
1. Strengthen capacity of the National Disaster Management Centre to coordinate national response to the virus outbreak 2. Procure and deliver COVID-19 medical supplies for i) enhanced infection control, ii) testing, and iii) treatment in isolation centers 3. Strengthen existing Regional (DRS), district (RAS) and community health (ASC) systems to maintain access to health in rural communities 4. Improve UN clinic’s responsiveness and preparedness
Output 2. Inclusive and multi-sectorial crisis management and response to COVID-19
Activities:
1. Community engagement for prevention, response and social cohesion through the creation of influencer networks in communities and between communities with a focus on human-rights protection, gender and inclusion of the most vulnerable, while working against stigma 2. Improve points of entry for participatory management and ensure community resilience in Cacheu and Gabu through community empowerment and community surveillance mechanisms 3. Ensure business continuity of technical government counterparts and communities to support public health responses 4. Supporting the coordination mechanism for national and regional response management and early warning system 5. Supporting the national communication plan for COVID-19 building on UN agencies channels and partnerships in order to yield on socio-behavioral change 6. Fact-check application for COVID related news with long-term focus on strengthening democratic and civic culture
Output 3. Socio-economic impact assessment of and recovery from COVID-19
1. Conducting a socio-economic assessment and action plan, considering the intertwined crises, including the analysis of food security 2. Conducting a socio-economic assessment and action plan, considering the intertwined crises, including the analysis of food security 3. Establish a civil society led observatory for the illicit economy 4. Implement Accelerator Lab anchored activities related to economic responses in Blue Economy.

Output 1. Strengthening health systems to respond to COVID-19 Output 2. Inclusive and multi-sectorial crisis management and response to COVID-19 Output 3. Socio-economic impact assessment of and recovery from COVID-19
